about_the_game:
Embark on a scientific mission
Congratulations photographer, you have been selected to participate in the exploration of the exoplanet Gliese 486B.
Your mission is to catalogue all the dinosaurs and other primitive creatures that live on this exoplanet.

Professor Edmee, in charge of the expedition, will be your supervisor on site and will give you your objectives.



Photograph, catalogue, interact
Your photos will allow us to learn more about this planet but also about the dinosaurs that lived on Earth.

Interact with the fauna to take the best pictures and discover all their behaviors.

All data will be entered into the Dinopedia.

Features
  • Take photos of the dinosaurs
  • Interact with the dinosaurs to see their reactions
  • Complete the "Dinopedia" encyclopedia
  • Find paths to new areas
  • Discover and solve the mysteries of the planet!



A peaceful mission!
No weapons are allowed on this mission.
In case of danger, your vehicle will automatically leave the area to avoid any risky situations.
You can therefore stroll peacefully, but beware: some dinosaurs may chase after you!



A planet full of mysteries
It seems that this planet is full of additional secrets.
A signal is coming from the surface, but the ship's sensors cannot identify it.
Go there and use the features of the exploration vehicle to learn more.

Have fun in virtual reality
VR is fun, and we've added features to make it even more enjoyable!
A machine for printing and storing photos in the ship
A training space for bait shooting
Moveable furniture
And many other things!

name: Jurassic Snap

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS *: Windows 7
  • Processor: Intel Core I5
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: RTX 2060
  • VR Support: Compatible with most VR devices Oculus, HTC Vive, Pico4

short_description: Jurassic Snap is a peaceful and calm photography game compatible with VR. Meet dinosaurs in this world, catalog all species and behaviors. Find secret passages to explore new areas and uncover the mysteries surrounding this planet.
